issue.title: Implement maximal zoom feature
issue.body: This is my first warm-up PR to RT. I decided to choose one of the simplest requested features #6693 from backlog, see [comment](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/issues/6693#issuecomment-1780000274). ### Changes: - Added the option to preferences to limit maximal zoom, possible options: unlimited, 100% - If max limit 100% is enabled, user cannot zoom the picture closer

comment.body: @Lawrence37 Done, could you have a look?

issue.title: Implement maximal zoom feature
issue.body: This is my first warm-up PR to RT. I decided to choose one of the simplest requested features #6693 from backlog, see [comment](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/issues/6693#issuecomment-1780000274). ### Changes: - Added the option to preferences to limit maximal zoom, possible options: unlimited, 100% - If max limit 100% is enabled, user cannot zoom the picture closer

comment.body:
Thank you for the answer, @Lawrence37!

Regarding the zoom, yes it's not really unlimited. It's limited with the default max zoom, which is 1600%. I guess it would be better to add all the possible options, like 100%, 200%, 400%, 800%, 1600% and leave it as a combo box.

Regarging the translations, I understood. Is there a document where I may see more details about the contribution? I still have a couple of questions there. For example, if I know a language, may I correct/add translations myself? (I see some translations are absent)

issue.title: Implement maximal zoom feature
issue.body: This is my first warm-up PR to RT. I decided to choose one of the simplest requested features #6693 from backlog, see [comment](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/issues/6693#issuecomment-1780000274). ### Changes: - Added the option to preferences to limit maximal zoom, possible options: unlimited, 100% - If max limit 100% is enabled, user cannot zoom the picture closer

comment.body:
Thanks for the pull request. One comment on the drop-down. Does "unlimited" really give you unlimited zoom or is it the current maximum? As an enhancement, you could add multiple reasonable limits e.g. 100%, 200%, 400%, 800%, 1600%, or replace the drop-down with a SpinButton.

For translations, you only need to update `default` which is written in American English. Translators will handle the other languages. You don't even need to update the English files. `English (US)` is redundant (I don't even know why it exists) and `English (UK)` is generated from `default`.
It seems like the one of the algorithms introduced in #6643 didn't work well because of this convertion to 0 all the time

pull_request.body: I've built rt in my environment and noticed a bunch of warnings. Some of them are easy to fix, and one of them seem to be important

issue.title: Support DNG WarpRectilinear opcode

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Something could be better than it currently is

issue.body:
Originally reported on Google Code with ID 2858

```
Hi,

I'm using RT for quite some time and I really like it. I'd like to post a feature request.


The idea is to support the WarpRectilinear opcode that some DNG files have. The opcode
specifies how the lens distortion should be corrected when demosaicing the DNG file.
Code for reading the opcode and correcting the distortion is available from Adobe as
part of the open source DNG SDK, in the utility dng_validate. Currently RT ignores
the opcode and therefore DNG files that contain it are uncorrected for distortion.

The ZIP file linked below includes the following files:
1_P7183225.ORF - Original RAW file in ORF format (taken with an Olympus E-M10 camera)
2_P7183225_OOC.jpg - Out of camera jpeg (downsized to 1MP)
3_P7183225.dng - DNG 1.4 file created with Adobe DNG Converter
4_P7183225_RT.jpg - Output of DNG file when converted to JPG in RT
5_P7183225_DNG_VALIDATE.tif - Output of DNG file when converted to TIFF using dng_validate.

ZIP (35MB):
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/21642925/RT_DNG_OPCODE.ZIP

As you can see, the out of camera jpeg and the file created by dng_validate are both
corrected for distortion, while the file created by RT is not. 

I tried to work with the DNG SDK in the past but it's a nightmare to get it to compile.
I didn't manage to build dng_validate locally. I'm also not familiar enough with RT's
code to implement such a feature by myself currently. I hope that this can be implemented
sometime in the future.

Thank you,
Assaf
```

Reported by `assaft` on 2015-07-26 20:03:33

comment.body:
Hello all,
I have implemented the WarpRectilinear function in the [DngOpcodesEditor](https://github.com/electro-logic/DngOpcodesEditor) that I released few days ago. Maybe you can play with it and see how it's implemented. It supports a single plane now, but can be easily extended.
Cheers,
Leonardo

issue.title: zoom 100% and stop (Settings)

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Something could be better than it currently is

labels.name: scope: GUI
labels.description: Changes to GUI, not core functionality

issue.body:
Hey i love this powerful tool 🥇 

I am working in zoomlevels up to 100%, but not more. It is hard to use the mousewheel because it jumps.

Can you please make an option in the Settings like `"minimum maximum zoom"` `[0...]` `[0...100...500]`

Via fields roughly like the HTML < option > element or concrete numbers?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/126161988/221690113-1fe506a5-b8d3-4f96-b524-1e7d02fc4fab.png)

This way anyone can set this to its perfect fit.

comment.body: Hey community! I've a wish to participate in the RawTherapee project as a contributor and decided to choose this ticket to be my good-first issue. I've already made a successfull attempt to implement it. It looks like on the screenshot for now and works perfectly. @Lawrence37 @Beep6581 @heckflosse @Desmis (mention the most active contributors): - Do you still think this is a worth-to-have feature? - If yes, would have time to see my PR?

issue.title: Crash on Export of One Particular Photo

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Something is not doing what it's supposed to be doing

issue.body:
RT repeatedly crashed when attempting to export one particular image. This occurred both when the image was in the midst of a long queue and when it was the only image in the queue. Removing the image from the queue allowed RT to export other images. Deleting the .pp3 file and reediting the image did not solve the problem. The bug report attached is from the most recent attempt on the reedited image.

RT 5.9-448-gb260663e
MacOS 13.5.2
Attached is the report, plus the image and the pp3 file, zipped.

[07240242 copy.ORF.zip](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/files/13127775/07240242.copy.ORF.zip)
[07240242.ORF.pp3.zip](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/files/13127778/07240242.ORF.pp3.zip)
[Translated Report.docx](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/files/13127779/Translated.Report.docx)

comment.body: Thanks Lawrence37. Sounds like this is an OS thing that I can't do anything about. I certainly applied a large amount of noise reduction to the image. Oddly, though, I applied the same noise reduction to two other similar images without generating an error. In any case, I hope this report was useful. I am so grateful to be the recipient of that thousand of hours of work creating RT.

issue.title: Crash on Export of One Particular Photo

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Something is not doing what it's supposed to be doing

issue.body:
RT repeatedly crashed when attempting to export one particular image. This occurred both when the image was in the midst of a long queue and when it was the only image in the queue. Removing the image from the queue allowed RT to export other images. Deleting the .pp3 file and reediting the image did not solve the problem. The bug report attached is from the most recent attempt on the reedited image.

RT 5.9-448-gb260663e
MacOS 13.5.2
Attached is the report, plus the image and the pp3 file, zipped.

[07240242 copy.ORF.zip](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/files/13127775/07240242.copy.ORF.zip)
[07240242.ORF.pp3.zip](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/files/13127778/07240242.ORF.pp3.zip)
[Translated Report.docx](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/files/13127779/Translated.Report.docx)

comment.body:
The relevant data in the crash report:
```
System Integrity Protection: enabled

Crashed Thread:        150

Exception Type:        EXC_CRASH (SIGABRT)
Exception Codes:       0x0000000000000000, 0x0000000000000000

Termination Reason:    Namespace SIGNAL, Code 6 Abort trap: 6
Terminating Process:   rawtherapee [8335]

Application Specific Information:
stack buffer overflow
```
```
Thread 150 Crashed:
0   libsystem_kernel.dylib                  0x7ff8190e9202 __pthread_kill + 10
1   libsystem_pthread.dylib                 0x7ff819120ee6 pthread_kill + 263
2   libsystem_c.dylib                       0x7ff819047bdf __abort + 139
3   libsystem_c.dylib                       0x7ff819032b72 __stack_chk_fail + 100
4   rawtherapee                                0x10cca4041 rtengine::ImProcFunctions::ShrinkAllAB(rtengine::wavelet_decomposition&, rtengine::wavelet_decomposition&, floa$
5   rawtherapee                                0x10cca48e2 .omp_outlined..4.16646 + 482
6   libomp.dylib                               0x10d625b63 __kmp_invoke_microtask + 147
7   libomp.dylib                               0x10d5daa7b __kmp_invoke_task_func + 367
8   libomp.dylib                               0x10d5d657c __kmp_fork_call + 6054
9   libomp.dylib                               0x10d5ca757 __kmpc_fork_call + 283
10  rawtherapee                                0x10cca45fd rtengine::ImProcFunctions::WaveletDenoiseAllAB(rtengine::wavelet_decomposition&, rtengine::wavelet_decompositio$
11  rawtherapee                                0x10ccaafcc .omp_outlined..23 + 7484
12  rawtherapee                                0x10cca824a rtengine::ImProcFunctions::RGB_denoise(int, rtengine::Imagefloat*, rtengine::Imagefloat*, rtengine::Imagefloat*$
13  rawtherapee                                0x10d0003e4 rtengine::(anonymous namespace)::ImageProcessor::stage_denoise() + 532
14  rawtherapee                                0x10cffc9e2 rtengine::processImage(rtengine::ProcessingJob*, int&, rtengine::ProgressListener*, bool) + 2610
15  rawtherapee                                0x10d00e6e3 rtengine::batchProcessingThread(rtengine::ProcessingJob*, rtengine::BatchProcessingListener*) + 67
16  libglibmm-2.4.1.dylib                      0x10d4f5549 (anonymous namespace)::call_thread_entry_slot(void*) + 35
17  libglib-2.0.0.dylib                        0x10e08214a g_thread_proxy + 66
18  libsystem_pthread.dylib                 0x7ff8191211d3 _pthread_start + 125
19  libsystem_pthread.dylib                 0x7ff81911cbd3 thread_start + 15
```

Looks like there's a stack overflow during noise reduction. I'm unable to reproduce the crash on my machine, probably because Linux gives a large stack than macOS by default.

issue.title: "Real" Hi-DPI support for RawTherapee GUI - Part 1

milestone.title: v6.0
milestone.description: This release will involve a code cleanup and break processing profile backward compatibility.

issue.body:
This PR brings "real" Hi-DPI support for RawTherapee GUI. Except for image related custom widgets (ex: thumbnail, image area, ...), all the RT GUI has been migrated to handle Hi-DPI.

Example 1:
- Before (RT 5.9):
![image](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/assets/40305292/1953de1e-8507-4a4c-b598-0df596728203)
- After (this PR):
![image](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/assets/40305292/e8aa9910-82d1-47f1-a16b-6dccd36a9aa9)

Example 2:
- Before (RT 5.9):
![image](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/assets/40305292/001f6765-f21e-464b-8d34-20f84c00970b)
- After (this PR):
![image](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/assets/40305292/0efcdc9e-3ba8-4707-b6ff-2898ad45546c)

This PR has been tested with the following environnements:
- Windows 11, 2K screen
- MacOS Ventura, MacBook Retina screen
- Debian Testing (VM), MacBook Retina screen

In a second PR, I will work on the image related custom widgets.

Detailed list of changes:
- Icons are now managed as Gtk Icon Theme. Surfaces are directly generated from .svg files and takes into account the DPI of the screen to avoid "blur" effect. To avoid reaching GDI limit on Windows, surfaces are buffered and reused (I hope it is handled differently in Gtk4...). Large parts of GUI code have been updated.
- Custom widget `on_draw` functions have been updated to handle Hi-DPI during drawing.
- Bug fix with Histogram panel widget: When loading an image, raw histogram data were incorectly not set (but provided)
- Bug fix with Histogram panel widget: Fixes incorrect curve scaling in raw histogram mode (was incorrectly scaled using luma and chroma data)
- Bug fix loading icon cache data: With some versions of Glib/Glibmm library on MacOS, Glib::KeyFile "load_from_file" function does not raise a Glib::Error but another exception. This causes cached data not saved on disk (and thumbnails not displayed in explorer). Adds robustness testing if file is present first before calling the function
- Bug fix loading dynamic profiles data: Same issue with Glib::KeyFile "load_from_file" funtion
- Cleanup of RT theme management
- Simplification of font size management as Pango/Gtk directly manage pt/px conversion based on screen DPI
- Bug fix in Preference panel: If panel is closed with "cancel" button, font size was not reinitialized to previously saved one
- Bug fix in `RawTherapee.css` theme: Font size was sprecified in css file and so user choice could be ignored

pull_request.title: "Real" Hi-DPI support for RawTherapee GUI - Part 1
pull_request.body:
This PR brings "real" Hi-DPI support for RawTherapee GUI. Except for image related custom widgets (ex: thumbnail, image area, ...), all the RT GUI has been migrated to handle Hi-DPI.

Example 1:

This PR has been tested with the following environnements:
- Windows 11, 2K screen
- MacOS Ventura, MacBook Retina screen
- Debian Testing (VM), MacBook Retina screen

In a second PR, I will work on the image related custom widgets.

Detailed list of changes:
- Icons are now managed as Gtk Icon Theme. Surfaces are directly generated from .svg files and takes into account the DPI of the screen to avoid "blur" effect. To avoid reaching GDI limit on Windows, surfaces are buffered and reused (I hope it is handled differently in Gtk4...). Large parts of GUI code have been updated.
- Custom widget `on_draw` functions have been updated to handle Hi-DPI during drawing.
- Bug fix with Histogram panel widget: When loading an image, raw histogram data were incorectly not set (but provided)
- Bug fix with Histogram panel widget: Fixes incorrect curve scaling in raw histogram mode (was incorrectly scaled using luma and chroma data)
- Bug fix loading icon cache data: With some versions of Glib/Glibmm library on MacOS, Glib::KeyFile "load_from_file" function does not raise a Glib::Error but another exception. This causes cached data not saved on disk (and thumbnails not displayed in explorer). Adds robustness testing if file is present first before calling the function
- Bug fix loading dynamic profiles data: Same issue with Glib::KeyFile "load_from_file" funtion
- Cleanup of RT theme management
- Simplification of font size management as Pango/Gtk directly manage pt/px conversion based on screen DPI
- Bug fix in Preference panel: If panel is closed with "cancel" button, font size was not reinitialized to previously saved one
- Bug fix in `RawTherapee.css` theme: Font size was sprecified in css file and so user choice could be ignored

issue.title: local spot: history-entries in default-file
issue.body:
The following history-entries in the default file of RawTherapee_dev_5.9-459-g46e5a63b6_win64_release are not used any more:
HISTORY_MSG_498;--unused--
HISTORY_MSG_499;--unused—

in former versions they were:
HISTORY_MSG_498;Local Spot name
HISTORY_MSG_499;Local Spot visibility

Now, when working on local spots, the messages in GUI are shown like this:

![history_msg_498](https://github.com/Beep6581/RawTherapee/assets/78749513/e81d8499-083f-472b-9b1b-f431e49f8f4a)

comment.body: Good catch @marter001. It was removed in commit 2197a9b. @Beep6581, did you intend to remove the history messages altogether or was it a mistake?

issue.title: Sinarback eVolution 75H .sti files
issue.body: Sinar will no longer be making digital backs or software.  They are going to concentrate on cameras and are going to support Phase One digital back and Capture One.  Sinar's software only supports up to macOS 10.13.6 (High Sierra) and all my Macs are new and only support macOS 12 (Monterey) on.  I have a number of Sinar RAW files (.sti) that I'd love to be able to open.

comment.body: You can add the sti extension as described [here](http://rawpedia.rawtherapee.com/Preferences#Parsed_Extensions). The images appear to be DNGs and RawTherapee can open them properly. If the results are not satisfactory and you want improved support, follow these instructions on RawPedia: http://rawpedia.rawtherapee.com/Adding_Support_for_New_Raw_Formats

- Icons are now managed as Gtk Icon Theme. Surfaces are directly generated from .svg files and takes into account the DPI of the screen to avoid "blur" effect. To avoid reaching GDI limit on Windows, surfaces are buffered and reused (I hope it is handled differently in Gtk4...). Large parts of GUI code have been updated.
- Custom widget `on_draw` functions have been updated to handle Hi-DPI during drawing.
- Bug fix with Histogram panel widget: When loading an image, raw histogram data were incorectly not set (but provided)
- Bug fix with Histogram panel widget: Fixes incorrect curve scaling in raw histogram mode (was incorrectly scaled using luma and chroma data)
- Bug fix loading icon cache data: With some versions of Glib/Glibmm library on MacOS, Glib::KeyFile "load_from_file" function does not raise a Glib::Error but another exception. This causes cached data not saved on disk (and thumbnails not displayed in explorer). Adds robustness testing if file is present first before calling the function
- Bug fix loading dynamic profiles data: Same issue with Glib::KeyFile "load_from_file" funtion
- Cleanup of RT theme management
- Simplification of font size management as Pango/Gtk directly manage pt/px conversion based on screen DPI
- Bug fix in Preference panel: If panel is closed with "cancel" button, font size was not reinitialized to previously saved one
- Bug fix in `RawTherapee.css` theme: Font size was sprecified in css file and so user choice could be ignored

milestone.title: v6.0
milestone.description: This release will involve a code cleanup and break processing profile backward compatibility.

issue.title: Whitebalance / Temperature correlation (itcwb) set in batch edit exports wrong wb until file is opened in editor

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Something is not doing what it's supposed to be doing

issue.body:
**Steps to reproduce**
1. Select unedited (or apply Neutral profile) image with the File Browser
2. Activate `Batch Edit` tab and set `Whitebalance` to `Temperature correlation` (note thumbnail colours)
3. Click `Put to queue` icon
4. Open the same file in Editor
5. `Put to queue` or `Save Current Image`
6. Compare the two images and note very different WB. Often the image is completely pink or otherwise off sometimes it's less noticeable.

Alternatively have a dynamic profile set the wb to Temperature correlation and export from File Browser.

**Expected behavior**
Images exported from File Browser should look like those exported from the Editor when no changes have been made. This should be the case even when the file hasn't been opened in the editor tab. 

A file with a dynamic profile set to use Temperature Correlation or the same set from batch mode should export a file where the full Temperature Correlation has been applied regardless of whether the file has been opened in the Editor.

**Additional information**
```
Version: 5.9-452-g88b0a5e45
Branch: 5.10
Commit: 88b0a5e45
Commit date: 2023-10-12
Compiler: cc 13.2.0
Processor: x86_64
System: Linux
Bit depth: 64 bits
Gtkmm: V3.24.8
Lensfun: V0.3.4.0
Build type: release
Build flags: -std=c++11 -Wno-deprecated-declarations -Wno-unused-result -O3 -msse2 -std=c++11 -ffp-contract=off -march=native -Werror=unused-label -Werror=delete-incomplete -fno-math-errno -Wno-attributes -flto -Wall -Wuninitialized -Wcast-qual -Wno-deprecated-declarations -Wno-unused-result -Wunused-macros -fopenmp -Werror=unknown-pragmas -O3 -DNDEBUG -ftree-vectorize
Link flags:  -march=native -flto
OpenMP support: ON
MMAP support: ON
Build OS: Linux 6.3.0-1-amd64 x86_64
Build date: Tue, 17 Oct 2023 17:06:06 +0000 UTC
Build epoch: 1697562366
Build UUID:
```


Other useful information:
It seems as if  ITCWB isn't initialized until the file is opened in the editor. Only some first step of setting a really off WB happens. The main issue with this that dynamic profiles become less useful. You have to "fully" edit all images and can't do quick exports with personal profiles.

comment.body:
I will have a look.
But not now, I'm not at home for another fortnight
